intro: Dischidia verruculosa, commonly known as the warty fig or wrinkled dischidia, is a climbing or trailing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, warty stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its unique appearance and ability to grow on trees make it a popular choice for indoor and hanging gardens. Dischidia verruculosa is also known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and requires minimal maintenance.
